Class ParseTree

java.lang.Object
Parser.ParseTree
public class ParseTree extends Object
A skeleton class to represent parse trees. The arity is not fixed: a node can have 0, 1 or more children. Trees are represented in the following way: Tree :== Symbol * List<Tree> In other words, trees are defined recursively: A tree is a root (with a label of type Symbol) and a list of trees children. Thus, a leave is simply a tree with no children (its list of children is empty). This class can also be seen as representing the Node of a tree, in which case a tree is simply represented as its root.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ParseTree(Symbol lbl)
    Creates a singleton tree with only a root labeled by lbl.
    ParseTree(Symbol lbl, List<ParseTree> chdn)
    Creates a tree with root labeled by lbl and children chdn.

      Creates a singleton tree with only a root labeled by lbl.

      lbl - The label of the root

    • ParseTree

      public ParseTree(Symbol lbl, List<ParseTree> chdn)
      Creates a tree with root labeled by lbl and children chdn.
      Parameters:
      lbl - The label of the root
      chdn - Its children

    • toLaTexTree

      public String toLaTexTree()
      Writes the tree as LaTeX code
      Returns:
      The LaTeX code in String

    • toTikZ

      public String toTikZ()
      Writes the tree as TikZ code. TikZ is a language to specify drawings in LaTeX files.
      Returns:
      The TikZ code in String

    • toTikZPicture

      public String toTikZPicture()
      Writes the tree as a TikZ picture. A TikZ picture embeds TikZ code so that LaTeX undertands it.
      Returns:
      the TiKZ picture in String

    • toForestPicture

      public String toForestPicture()
      Writes the tree as a forest picture. Returns the tree in forest enviroment using the latex code of the tree
      Returns:
      the forestPicture in String

    • toLaTeX

      public String toLaTeX()
      Writes the tree as a LaTeX document which can be compiled using PDFLaTeX.

      The result can be used with the command: 
      pdflatex some-file.tex
      Returns:
      the LaTeX code in String
